channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #225 - Nominations for the White Camel Award: It's On
item.description: This week's biggest news is actually a non-news type of news: YAPC::NA is still looking for its 2016 location. But despite this meddling, temporary snag, the bigger show goes on. brian d foy is now taking nominations for the 2015 White Camel Award, and there's a DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop coming in in the new year. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Nominate Perl heroes for the 2015 White Camel Awards
item.description: The White Camel award recognizes and celebrates the non-technical achievements of a member of the Perl community. Know somebody who's deserving of that monochromatic humped Thank You this year? Submit their name to brian d foy!

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: November 2nd-9th
item.description: The weekly, at-a-glance, view of what happened in the P5P world.

item.title: Alexis Sukrieh, choreographer of Perl's Dancer community
item.description: Andrew interviews Alexis Sukrieh and traces back with him the genesis of its creation, the Dancer micro-web framework.

item.title: DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop 2016!!! Call for Speakers
item.description: The fifth installment, which will happen next April, of the DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop is revving up. If you want to be part of the fun, now is the time to submit your talks.

item.title: YAPC::NA::2016 Update #1
item.description: So, where's the next YAPC::NA going to be? Turns out the answer has... not yet stabilized yet. Dan fills us on the current state of affair.

item.title: Win Some, Test::Some
item.description: A new module that alters the behavior of Test::More's subtest such as to allow to only run a subset of a file's tests.

item.title: Test plan and test descriptions
item.description: What is the 'plan' in the tests written in Perl?

item.title: Formal deprecation of GraphViz V 2.19 - Use GraphViz2
item.description: GraphViz is deprecated. Long live GraphViz2!

item.title: CMS based Mojolicious
item.description: There is a brand new CMS in town.

item.title: Single Page Application with Perl Dancer and AngularJS
item.description: Dancer now allows you to create your own skeleton for new projects. This is a skeleton that makes it easy to create a Single-Page Application. One where your client-side applications talks to the web serve using AJAX.

item.title: Perl Dancer book available
item.description: All the Perl Maven articles related to Perl Dancer, now available bundled in one e-book in MOBI format for Kindle.

item.title: Production Today
item.description: Halloween is behind us. As Ed Stark would undoubiously say: Christmas is coming.

item.title: What should Rakudo-js aim for first?
item.description: Pawel is considering putting his shoulder to the task of porting Rakudo to JavaScript, and he's asking for feedback as what should be his first concrete goalpost.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.
